original_text: ELRs are particularly attractive for the synthesis of block copolymers that self-assemble into polymer nanostructures such as micelles. The first work in this area involved an elastin-mimetic di-block copolymer containing VPGEG–(IPGAG)4 and VPGFG–(IPGVG)4 as the hydrophilic and hydrophobic blocks, respectively [49]. The resulting micelles were studied by dynamic light scattering (DLS) and DSC was used to measure the enthalpy of self-assembly. A tri-block copolymer was subsequently synthesized and the TEM images of this polymer showed that it formed spherical aggregates [50]. Other multivalent spherical micelles have been obtained from linear elastin-like AB di-block copolymers in the temperature range 37–42°C with the aim of targeting cancer cells [51]. Bidwell et al. have also exploited the ELRs for its ability to serve as macromolecular carriers for thermally targeted delivery of drugs. Attachment of doxorubicin to ELR-based system showed enhanced cytotoxicity in uterine sarcoma cells when aggregation was induced with hyperthermia [52].
original_translation: Los ELRs son particularmente atractivos para la síntesis de copolímeros en bloque que se autoensamblan en nanoestructuras poliméricas como micelas. El primer trabajo en esta área involucró un copolímero di-bloque mimético de elastina que contenía VPGEG–(IPGAG)4 y VPGFG–(IPGVG)4 como bloques hidrofílico e hidrofóbico, respectivamente. Las micelas resultantes fueron estudiadas mediante dispersión dinámica de luz (DLS) y se utilizó DSC para medir la entalpía de autoensamblaje. Posteriormente se sintetizó un copolímero tri-bloque y las imágenes de TEM de este polímero mostraron que formaba agregados esféricos. Otras micelas esféricas multivalentes se obtuvieron a partir de copolímeros di-bloque lineales tipo elastina en el rango de temperatura de 37–42°C con el objetivo de dirigirse a células cancerosas. Bidwell et al. también han explotado los ELRs por su capacidad de servir como transportadores macromoleculares para la entrega dirigida térmicamente de fármacos. La unión de doxorrubicina al sistema basado en ELR mostró una citotoxicidad mejorada en células de sarcoma uterino cuando se indujo la agregación con hipertermia.

original_annotated_sentences:
ELRs
are particularly attractive for the synthesis of block copolymers that self-assemble into polymer nanostructures such as micelles.
The first work in this area involved an elastin-mimetic di-block copolymer containing VPGEG–(IPGAG)4 and VPGFG–(IPGVG)4 as the hydrophilic and hydrophobic blocks, respectively [49].
The resulting micelles were studied by dynamic light scattering (DLS) and DSC was used to measure the enthalpy of self-assembly.
A tri-block copolymer was subsequently synthesized and the TEM images of this polymer showed that it formed spherical aggregates [50].
Other multivalent spherical micelles have been obtained from linear elastin-like AB di-block copolymers in the temperature range 37–42°C with the aim of targeting cancer cells [51].

Bidwell et al. have also exploited the
ELRs
for its ability to serve as macromolecular carriers for thermally targeted delivery of drugs.
Attachment of doxorubicin to ELR-based system showed enhanced cytotoxicity in uterine sarcoma cells when aggregation was induced with hyperthermia [52].

The resulting micelles were studied by dynamic light scattering (DLS) and DSC was used to measure the enthalpy of self-assembly.

A tri-block copolymer was subsequently synthesized and the TEM images of this polymer showed that it formed
spherical aggregates
[50].
Other multivalent spherical micelles have been obtained from linear elastin-like AB di-block copolymers in the temperature range 37–42°C with the aim of targeting cancer cells [51].
Bidwell et al. have also exploited the ELRs for its ability to serve as macromolecular carriers for thermally targeted delivery of drugs.
Attachment of doxorubicin to ELR-based system showed enhanced cytotoxicity in uterine sarcoma cells when aggregation was induced with hyperthermia [52].

spherical aggregates.translated_text:
Los ELRs son particularmente atractivos para la síntesis de copolímeros en bloque que se autoensamblan en nanoestructuras poliméricas como micelas. El primer trabajo en esta área involucró un copolímero di-bloque mimético de elastina que contenía VPGEG–(IPGAG)4 y VPGFG–(IPGVG)4 como bloques hidrofílico e hidrofóbico, respectivamente. Las micelas resultantes fueron estudiadas mediante dispersión dinámica de luz (DLS) y se utilizó DSC para medir la entalpía de autoensamblaje. Posteriormente se sintetizó un copolímero tri-bloque y las imágenes de TEM de este polímero mostraron que formaba
agregados esféricos
. Otras micelas esféricas multivalentes se obtuvieron a partir de copolímeros di-bloque lineales tipo elastina en el rango de temperatura de 37–42°C con el objetivo de dirigirse a células cancerosas. Bidwell et al. también han explotado los ELRs por su capacidad de servir como transportadores macromoleculares para la entrega dirigida térmicamente de fármacos. La unión de doxorrubicina al sistema basado en ELR mostró una citotoxicidad mejorada en células de sarcoma uterino cuando se indujo la agregación con hipertermia.
